definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)

sentences.english: Now, there are some immediate bad explanations for this.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有人提出一些错漏百出的解释。

sentences.english: Office workers in South Korea have been trying various ways to peek at the Olympic matches during working hours.
sentences.chinese: 为在上班时间偷看奥运比赛，韩国上班族花样百出。

sentences.english: His remark is full of contradictions and flaws.
sentences.chinese: 他的话前后矛盾，破绽百出。

sentences.english: Done in a hurry, his homework was full of mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 由于完成得很匆忙，他的作业错漏百出。

sentences.english: Well, monkeys make us smile, too, because they are creatures full of playful tricks.
sentences.chinese: 猴子也能让我们发笑，因为它们是花样百出的生灵。

sentences.english: Remember to stop, do not let me pierce the paper goes on already full of loopholes.
sentences.chinese: 记得适可而止，别让我捅破那张早已漏洞百出的纸。

sentences.english: Fashion designers make every effort to show variety and create something new to attract attention.
sentences.chinese: 时装设计师要不停地推陈出新，力求花样百出。

sentences.english: This is an argument shot through with inconsistency.
sentences.chinese: 这个论点前后矛盾，漏洞百出。

sentences.english: Don't act so foolishly, John. Come to your senses.
sentences.chinese: 别丑态百出啦，约翰，放理智点。

sentences.english: Jarvis points out that the earliest books were riddled with errors.
sentences.chinese: 贾维斯指出，最早期的书籍错漏百出。

sentences.english: The girl was frightened by the audience and floundered through her song.
sentences.chinese: 这个女孩子被听众吓坏了，因而她唱的歌错误百出。

sentences.english: Robert was well away after the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 婚礼之后罗伯特已是醉态百出。

sentences.english: Ep680 - Kexin still misses her late father very much. She performs badly at work.
sentences.chinese: 可欣仍放不下对亡父四川的思念，工作错漏百出。

sentences.english: The witness tripped up rather badly under close cross-examination.
sentences.chinese: 这个证人在严密的交叉盘问之下破绽百出。

definition: (of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
to exceed all expectations/to come as a surprise
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
to win by a surprise move
